cs.DC, cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with the design of regeneration codes for fault tolerance in distributed storage systems, which is a topic that falls under the category of Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC). The paper also discusses the use of integrity checks and progressive decoding mechanisms, which are concepts related to Information Theory (cs.IT) and Error-Correcting Codes (cs.CR). The paper specifically addresses the issue of Byzantine failures, which is a topic related to Distributed Systems (cs.DS) and System and Control Theory (cs.SY). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.DC, followed by cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DS, and cs.SY.
